variables.name: Marital status
variables.desc: People married or in civil partnerships.

categories.name: Single never married or in a civil partnership
categories.desc: Households where the members are single and have never been married or in a civil partnership.

categories.name: Married
categories.desc: Households where the members are married.

categories.name: In a registered civil partnership
categories.desc: Households where the members are in a registered civil partnership..

categories.name: Separated (but still legally married)
categories.desc: Households where the members are separated but still legally married.

categories.name: Divorced or civil partnership dissolved
categories.desc: Households where the members are either divorced or a civil partnership has been dissolved.

categories.name: Widowed or surviving civil partnership partner
categories.desc: Households where the members widowed or a surviving civil partner.

total.name: All categories: Marital and civil partnership status

variables.name: Families living in the same home
variables.desc: Types of families living in the same home.

categories.name: One person households
categories.desc: One person household is when someone lives on their own.

categories.name: Single family households
categories.desc: Single family household is when one family live in the same home.

variables.name: Length of time people have lived in the UK
variables.desc: People born or have moved to the UK.

categories.name: Born in the UK
categories.desc: People born in the UK or have emigrated and have returned.

categories.name: Less than 2 years
categories.desc: This is the length of time someone who was not born in the UK has recently lived here.
categories.category_h_pt2: of {category_unit} in {location} have lived in the UK
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) have lived in the UK {category_name}.

categories.name: 2 to 4 years
categories.desc: This is the length of time someone who was not born in the UK has recently lived here.
categories.category_h_pt2: of {category_unit} in {location} have lived in the UK
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) have lived in the UK {category_name}.

categories.name: 5 to 9 years
categories.desc: This is the length of time someone who was not born in the UK has recently lived here.
categories.category_h_pt2: of {category_unit} in {location} have lived in the UK
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) have lived in the UK {category_name}.

categories.name: 10 years or more
categories.desc: This is the length of time someone who was not born in the UK has recently lived here.
categories.category_h_pt2: of {category_unit} in {location} have lived in the UK
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) have lived in the UK {category_name}.

total.name: All categories: Length of residence in the UK

name: Education
desc: People in education and qualifications they hold.

variables.name: Highest level of qualification gained
variables.desc: Highest qualification gained by residents.

categories.name: No qualifications
categories.desc: People that do not have any qualifications.

categories.name: Level 1 qualifications
categories.desc: Level 1 qualifications are GCSE (grades 3 to 1 or grades, D to G), level 1 award, certificate, diploma or NVQ , Welsh Baccalaureate Foundation Diploma.

categories.name: Level 2 qualifications
categories.desc: Level 2 qualifications are GCSE (grades 9 to 4 or grades A* to C), O level (grade A to C or pass), level 2 award, certificate or NVQ, Welsh Baccalaureate Diploma.

categories.name: Level 3 qualifications
categories.desc: Level 3 qualifications are A level, AS level, level 3 award, certificate, diploma or NVQ, Welsh Baccalaureate, International Baccalaureate.

categories.name: Level 4 qualifications and above
categories.desc: Level 4 qualifications and above are certificate of higher education (CertHE), higher national certificate (HNC), level 4 award, certificate, diploma or NVQ, diploma of higher education (DipHE), higher national diploma (HND), degree, master's degree or doctorate.

categories.name: Apprenticeship
categories.desc: People who have a Modern Apprenticeship.

categories.name: Other qualifications
categories.desc: People that have other qualifications not covered by levels 1 to 4.

total.name: All categories: Highest level of qualification

name: Housing
desc: Types of homes and the people living in them.

variables.name: Size of household
variables.desc: Number of people who usually live together in the same home.

categories.name: 1 person households
categories.desc: This is a home with 1 person living on their own.

categories.name: 2 person households
categories.desc: This is a home shared by 2 people.

categories.name: 3 person households
categories.desc: This is a home shared by 3 people.

categories.name: 4 person households
categories.desc: This is a home shared by 4 people.

categories.name: 5 person households
categories.desc: This is a home shared by 5 people.

variables.name: Type of home
variables.desc: Types of homes people live in.

categories.name: Whole houses or bungalows
categories.desc: This is a property that has not been split into separate flats or other accommodation.

categories.name: Flats, maisonettes or apartments
categories.desc: This could be in a purpose built block or tenement, part of a converted or shared house (including bedsits), part of another converted building.

categories.name: Caravans or other temporary structures
categories.desc: This could include camper vans, canal barges, converrted railway carriages,garden building or shed, houseboats, mobile homes, tents, trailers.

categories.name: Shared homes
categories.desc: A home is shared if the household spaces it contains are part of a converted or shared house or not all rooms are behind closed doors.

variables.name: Number of bedrooms
variables.desc: The number of dedicated bedrooms in a home

categories.name: No dedicated bedroom
categories.desc: This type of home has no dedicated bedroom. This could be a bedsit or studio apartment.

categories.name: 1 bedroom
categories.desc: This type of home has 1 dedicated bedroom.

categories.name: 2 bedrooms
categories.desc: This type of home has 2 dedicated bedrooms.

categories.name: 3 bedrooms
categories.desc: This type of home has 3 dedicated bedrooms.

categories.name: 4 bedrooms
categories.desc: This type of home has 4 dedicated bedrooms.

categories.name: 5 or more bedrooms
categories.desc: This type of home has 5 or more dedicated bedrooms.

variables.name: Owned or renting
variables.desc: People that live in a home they rent or own.

categories.name: Owned homes
categories.desc: This is a home where the home owner either owns the home outright, has a mortage or loan on the property.

categories.name: Shared ownership homes
categories.desc: This is a home that is part rented and part owned.

categories.name: Social rented homes
categories.desc: This is a home where the tenants pays rent to a local authority or housing association.

categories.name: Private rented homes
categories.desc: This is a home where the tenants pay rent to a private landlord.

variables.name: Car or van availability
variables.desc: People living in the same home that have use of or own a car or van.

categories.name: No cars or vans available
categories.desc: The people living in this home do not have a car or van available to use.

categories.name: 1 car or van
categories.desc: This is the number of cars or vans people living in the same home own or use.

categories.name: 2 cars or vans
categories.desc: This is the number of cars or vans people living in the same home own or use.

total.name: All categories: Car or van availability

variables.name: Heating
variables.desc: Types of central heating available for use in the home.

categories.name: No central heating
categories.desc: This home does not have central heating.

categories.name: Gas central heating
categories.desc: This central heating system is fuelled by gas and heats more than one room in a building.

categories.name: Electric central heating (including storage heaters)
categories.desc: This central heating system is fuelled by electricity (inlcuding storage heaters) and heats more than one room in a building.

categories.name: Oil central heating
categories.desc: This central heating system is fuelled by oil heats more than one room in a building.

categories.name: Solid fuel central heating (for example wood, coal)
categories.desc: This central heating system is fuelled by a solid fuel such as wood or coal and heats more than one room in a building.

categories.name: Other central heating
categories.desc: This central heating system is not fuelled by a solid fuel, oil, gas or electricity. It heats more than one room in a building.

categories.name: Two or more types of central heating
categories.desc: This central heating system has more than one fuel source and heats more than one room in a building.

total.name: All categories: Type of central heating in household

variables.name: Residence type
variables.desc: Families and other groups living in the same home or communal establishment.

categories.name: Live in a household
categories.desc: A place where people live alone or together.

categories.name: Live in a communal establishment
categories.desc: A place that provides managed residential accommodation.

variables.name: Economic activity
variables.desc: People who are in work, starting work, looking for or do not work.

categories.name: Economically active
categories.desc: Anyone aged 16 years and over was economically active if they were employed, waiting to start work or looking for work at the time of the census.

categories.name: Economically inactive
categories.desc: Economically inactive people did not have a job, had not looked for work or could not start work at the time of the census.

variables.name: Working hours
variables.desc: Hours people work per week.

categories.name: Part-time
categories.desc: These are people that work between 15 and 30 hours per week.

categories.name: Full-time
categories.desc: These are people that work a minimum of 31 hours per week.

variables.name: Job
variables.desc: The types of jobs people do or did.

categories.name: Managers, directors and senior officials
categories.desc: People whose work activities or job title are a manager, director or senior official in their main job.

categories.name: Professional occupations
categories.desc: People whose work activities or job title are a professional in their main job.

categories.name: Associate professionals and technical occupations
categories.desc: People whose work activities at or job titles are associate or technical professionals in their main job.

categories.name: Administrative and secretarial occupations
categories.desc: People whose work activities or job titles are administrative or secretarial in their main job.

categories.name: Process, plant and machine operatives
categories.desc: People whose work activities or job titles are process, plant and machine operative in their main job.

categories.name: Unskilled or semi-skilled occupations
categories.desc: People whose work activities or job titles are unskilled or semi-skilled in their main job.

variables.name: Travel to work
variables.desc: Types of transport people use to travel to work.

categories.name: Work mainly from home
categories.desc: People that mainly work from home do not travel to work for their main job.

categories.name: London Underground, metro, light rail, or tram
categories.desc: People that use London Underground (the tube), metro, light rail or tram for the longest, part by, distance of their journey to their main job.
categories.category_h_pt2: of {category_unit} in {location} travel to work by
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) travel to work by {category_name}.

categories.name: Train
categories.desc: People that use a train for the longest part, by distance, of their journey to their main job.
categories.category_h_pt2: of {category_unit} in {location} travel to work by
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) travel to work by {category_name}.

categories.name: Bus, minibus or coach
categories.desc: People that use a bus, minibus or coach for the longest part, by distance, of their journey to their main job.
categories.category_h_pt2: of {category_unit} in {location} travel to work by
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) travel to work by {category_name}.

categories.name: Motorcycle, scooter or moped
categories.desc: People that use a motorcycle, scooter or moped for the longest part, by distance, of their journey to their main job.
categories.category_h_pt2: of {category_unit} in {location} travel to work by
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) travel to work by {category_name}.

categories.name: Bicycle
categories.desc: People that use a bicyle for the longest part, by distance, of their journey to their main job.
categories.category_h_pt2: of {category_unit} in {location} travel to work by
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) travel to work by {category_name}.

categories.name: Walk
categories.desc: People that walk for the longest part, by distance, of their journey to their main job.
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) walk to work.

categories.name: Other
categories.desc: People that use other means of transport for the longest part by distance of their journey to their main job.
categories.category_h_pt2: of {category_unit} in {location} travel to work by
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) travel to work using alternative methods of transport such as ferry.

total.name: All categories: Method of travel to work

variables.name: Distance travelled to work
variables.desc: The daily distance travelled to work.

categories.name: Less than 2km
categories.desc: People that travel less than 2 km (1.25 miles) to their main job.
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) travel {category_name} to work.

categories.name: 2km to less than 5km
categories.desc: People that travel between 2 km (1.25 miles) and 5 km (3.10 miles) to their main job.
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) travel between 2 km (1.25 miles) and 5 km (3.10 miles) to their main job.

categories.name: 5km to less than 10km
categories.desc: People that travel between 5 km (3.10 miles) and 10 km (6.21 miles) to their main job.
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) travel between 5 km (3.10 miles) and 10 km (6.21 miles) to their main job.

categories.name: 10km to less than 20km
categories.desc: People that travel between 10 km (6.21 miles) and 20 km (12.42 miles) to their main job.
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) travel between 10 km (6.21 miles) and 20 km (12.42 miles) to their main job.

categories.name: 20km to less than 30km
categories.desc: People that travel between 20 km (12.42 miles) and 30 km (18.64 miles) to their main job.
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) travel between 20 km (12.42 miles) and 30 km (18.64 miles) to their main job.

categories.name: 30km to less than 40km
categories.desc: People that travel between 30 km (18.64 miles) and 40 km (24.85 miles) to their main job.
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) travel between 30 km (18.64 miles) and 40 km (24.85 miles) to their main job.

categories.name: 40km to less than 60km
categories.desc: People that travel between 40 km (24.85 miles) and 60 km (37.28 miles) to their main job.
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage})travel between 40 km (24.85 miles) and 60 km (37.28 miles) to their main job.

categories.name: 60km and over
categories.desc: People that travel over 60 km (37.28 miles) to their main job.
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) travel over 60 km (37.28 miles) to their main job.

categories.name: Mainly work from home
categories.desc: People that mainly work from home so do not travel to work for their main job.
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) work from home.

categories.name: Other
categories.desc: People that neither travel to work or work from home.
categories.category_h_pt3: work offshore, outside of UK or at no fixed location
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) either have no fixed place of work, work on an offshore installation or work outside of the UK.

total.name: All categories: Distance travelled to work

name: Health
desc: People's general health and caring responsibilities.

variables.name: General health
variables.desc: How people rate their general health.

categories.name: Very good health
categories.desc: This is someone's own opinion that best describes their overall state of health as very good most of the time.

categories.name: Good health
categories.desc: This is someone's own opinion that best describes their overall state of health as good most of the time.

categories.name: Fair health
categories.desc: This is someone's own opinion that best describes their overall state of health as fair most of the time.

categories.name: Bad health
categories.desc: This is someone's own opinion that best describes their overall state of health as bad most of the time.

categories.name: Very bad health
categories.desc: This is someone's own opinion that best describes their overall state of health as very bad most of the time.

variables.name: Long-term conditions
variables.desc: How people's health affects their day-to-day activities.

categories.name: No long-term condition
categories.desc: Non-disabled people are able to carry out their day-to-day activities without being limited by a physical or mental health condition.
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) do not have a long-term health condition.

categories.name: Day-to-day activities limited a little
categories.desc: People with a long-term physical or mental health condition (lasting or expected to last 12 months or more) that limits their day-to-day activities a little.
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) have their day to day activities limited a little.

categories.name: Day-to-day activities limited a lot
categories.desc: People with a long-term physical or mental health condition (lasting or expected to last 12 months or more) that limits their day-to-day activities a lot.
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) have their day to day activities limited a lot.

total.name: All categories: Long-term health problem or disability

variables.name: Unpaid care
variables.desc: People who provide unpaid care.

categories.name: Do not provide unpaid care
categories.desc: People who do not provide unpaid help or support to anyone who has a long-term physical or mental health condition or illness, or problems related to old age.

categories.name: Provide 1 to 19 hours unpaid care a week
categories.desc: People who provide unpaid help or support to anyone who has a long-term physical or mental health condition or illness, or problems related to old age.

categories.name: Provide 20 to 49 hours unpaid care a week
categories.desc: People who provide unpaid help or support to anyone who has a long-term physical or mental health condition or illness, or problems related to old age.

categories.name: Provide 50 or more hours unpaid care a week
categories.desc: People who provide unpaid help or support to anyone who has a long-term physical or mental health condition or illness, or problems related to old age.

total.name: All categories: Provision of unpaid care

name: Identity

categories.name: Asian/Asian British: Bangladeshi

categories.name: Asian/Asian British: Chinese

categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) are Asian/Asian British: Chinese.

categories.desc: People who identified themselves as belonging to this ethnic group.

categories.desc: People who identified themselves as belonging to this ethnic group.

categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) are Mixed/multiple ethnic group: Other Mixed.

categories.name: White: English/Welsh/Scottish/Northern Irish/British
categories.desc: People who identified themselves as belonging to this ethnic group.

variables.name: Ethnic groups living together
variables.desc: The mixture of ethnic groups in a single household.

categories.name: All household members from the same ethnic group
categories.desc: Households where all members are from the same ethnic group.

categories.name: Different ethnic groups between the generations only
categories.desc: Households where the members are not the the same between generations.

categories.name: Different ethnic groups within partnerships
categories.desc: Households where the members in a partnership are from different ethnic groups.

categories.name: Any other combination of multiple ethnic groups

categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) have other combination of multiple ethnic groups.

variables.name: Religion and beliefs
variables.desc: People's religion and beliefs.

categories.name: No religion
categories.desc: People who neither practice or identify with any religion.

categories.name: Christian
categories.desc: This is someone who identify with as Christian whether they practice or have belief in it.

categories.name: Buddhist
categories.desc: This is someone who identify with as Buddhist whether they practice or have belief in it.

categories.name: Hindu
categories.desc: This is someone who identify with as Hindu whether they practice or have belief in it.

categories.name: Jewish
categories.desc: This is someone who identify with as Jewish whether they practice or have belief in it.

categories.name: Muslim
categories.desc: This is someone who identify with as Muslim whether they practice or have belief in it.

categories.name: Sikh
categories.desc: This is someone who identify with as Sikh whether they practice or have belief in it.

categories.name: Other religion
categories.desc: This is someone who identify with as another religion whether they practice or have belief in it.
categories.category_h_pt3: do not follow one of the main religions
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) do not follow one of the main religions.

categories.name: Not stated

categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) have {category_name} their religion.

categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) were born in The United Kingdom.

categories.name: Europe, Ireland
categories.desc: People born in Ireland.
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) were born in Ireland

categories.name: Other Europe

categories.category_h_pt3: Europe (excluding The United Kingdom or Ireland).
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) were born in Europe (excluding The United Kingdom or Ireland).

categories.name: Africa
categories.desc: People born in Africa
categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) were born in Africa.

categories.name: Middle East and Asia

categories.cat_location_summary_pt2: Out of {category_total} {category_unit} in {location}, {category_value} ({category_percentage}%) were born in the Middle East or Asia.
